It's been truly humbling to see all of the amazing things the hardworking men and women of the 17th Congressional District do every day. I look forward to doing more Cheri on Shifts soon to learn more about how we work and develop new solutions to grow our local economy.

During a Cheri on Shift at Sterling Steel, I saw all of the incredible work they do and had an opportunity to talk about my bill to strengthen "Buy America" requirements for drinking water infrastructure.

At Performance Pattern & Machine in Peoria, they have incredibly high tech machinery to build specialized components for construction companies. I had a great time seeing how they're using 21st century techniques to build high quality American products.
During my Cheri on Shift at Moline Forge, they showed me how to work as a Trimming Operator. It's hard work cutting excess metal off 3,200 degree billetts!
Also in Rockford, I stopped by Specialty Screw Corp for a Cheri on Shift where they taught me how to make screws, nuts and bolt. It's so important that we keep jobs like these here in America!

For my 50th Cheri on Shift, I visited AAR in Rockford. Senator Durbin and I helped secure $24 million in federal funds to grow our aerospace industry - today they're creating good-paying jobs in the airport maintenance field!

At a Cheri on Shift in Machesney Park, I learned how to make floor tiles out of injected plastic - Then I learned how those tiles are interlocked to create sports flooring. They're doing really high quality work at PPI!

At Spoon River Electric Coop in Canton, I learned how to convert mercury vapor/high pressure sodium lights into LED lights. Later, in Cuba, I helped install some of those lights. There are some really amazing workers on the cutting edge of our new energy economy.
On this Labor Day, I'm thinking about all of the hardworking men and women I've met over the years job shadowing them during "Cheri on Shift" events. Here's just a few of those stories:
